text: The South Greenland Triple Junction was a geologic triple junction in the North Atlantic Ocean that divided the North American, Greenland and Eurasian plates. It existed during the Paleogene and consisted of the Mid-Labrador and Mid-Atlantic ridges. The triple junction became extinct when seafloor spreading along the Mid-Labrador Ridge ceased during the Eocene. ==References== Category:Triple junctions Category:Paleogene geology Category:Mid-Atlantic Ridge
title: South Greenland Triple Junction
